1551108132_1P4KkC3wa5xtGD8m2MoBTf5p69G3X.body: yes, and you can always see the rest of the world as long as you use tor

> [kaffie](#comment_802_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): The concern is if the russian government physically seizes the routing nodes that deliver traffic to outside of the country. They can easily just block any traffic they don't like or cut off routing entirely. Tor won't help in that situation. Even if you had a mesh net to hop the border, tor wouldn't really help you.

yet one can use the obfs4 or meek-azure (works even in chine) plugins to connect to the tor network and the gov may even not be able to notice that someone is using tor
